value.original:
Use Module Management to browse the currently installed modules, to check for updates to installed modules and search for new modules to install.

Installed Modules

View the details of currently installed modules. You can also find updates to installed modules. Uninstall installed modules, disable or enable modules and rebuild the system after installing/uninstalling a module.

Add Modules

Search for a specific module, or browse all available modules in the Central Repository. You can also browse for modules from the file system. Click Install Now to install a module.

Installation History

View the history of module installations/uninstallations and errors that may have occurred during these processes.

System Rebuild

After installing or uninstalling a module, you must restart the application context for any changes to take effect.
  • Restart server: Restarts the application server and launches the login screen.
  • Take no action: Select if you intend to restart the server or reload the application manually, later.

row.value:
Use Module Management to browse the currently installed modules, to check for updates to installed modules and search for new modules to install.

Installed Modules

View the details of currently installed modules. You can also find updates to installed modules. Uninstall installed modules, disable or enable modules and rebuild the system after installing/uninstalling a module.

Add Modules

Search for a specific module, or browse all available modules in the Central Repository. You can also browse for modules from the file system. Click Install Now to install a module.

Installation History

View the history of module installations/uninstallations and errors that may have occurred during these processes.

System Rebuild

After installing or uninstalling a module, you must restart the application context for any changes to take effect.
  • Restart server: Restarts the application server and launches the login screen.
  • Take no action: Select if you intend to restart the server or reload the application manually, later.
